--- In samuraihistory@y..., "kingscarbine" <headburner@h...> wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> Can anyone tell me if the Ashigaru wore or not Sashimono in battle? 
> Was there a specific number of Sashimono per unit? What Ashigaru 
> units were more likely to wear them? 
> 
> Thanks,
> 
> Nuno Pereira


Some Ashigaru were supplied with Sashimono by their Daimyo. Some 
Daimyo did not. Uniformed ashigaru seemed to be used during the main 
period of Sengoku about 1570-1600. My dates might be a bit off but it 
seems to me to coincide with the rise of professional ashigaru during 
the later years. Each ashigaru would have one if so organized.

BTW is your real name Nuno Pereira??? I ask because I am Portuguese 
and that name rings a bell regarding a general by I believe the same 
name during the wars vs Castille in the late 14 th century.
